column4: Uhm, I tried to install quota, and did a "quotacheck -avugm" which to so long I ctrl+c it, now, I can't do a whole lot any longer. including deleting those lines I added to /etc/fstab. Any ideas? :D
Nobody have any ideas about what to do with my corrupt /etc/fstab? :D
can you just make a new one?
just rename it and write a new one, if you need i can give you mine for a starting point
I can't write to my file system any longer, lol
actually it might have to be ../etc/fstab
sudo stands for super user do
Uhm, my whole hda1 is read-only now.
i am a ubuntu noob too so dont have too many ideas... maybe try restarting or manually unmounting and remounting?
